result.execSummary:
The defendant Garcia J Schlieve was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must petition the court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No contact with any victim or co-defendant.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant made appearance later in the day after bail was forfeited.

Defendant Garcia J Schlieve in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amend counts 1, 4, and 6.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1, 4, and 6.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 18 months
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with any victim or co-defendant.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Maintain/Obtain employment and or school;
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #6.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 18 months
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with any victim or co-defendant.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Maintain/Obtain employment and or school;
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #4
10 days Jail, no huber allowed, 0 days credit.
Costs:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation from Charge #1 and 6.  
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Case called at 8:35 am for an 8:15 am.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Garcia J Schlieve did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff advises he does not know where his client is at this time.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Court issues a capias, cashbail in the amount of $1,000.00.
Plea hearing on July 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Court trial on July 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Garcia J Schlieve in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff moves to have the matter changed from a jury trial to a court trial.  Matter adjourned to 10:30 to get an answer from the State regarding the waiver of the jury trial.  Defendant is excused at 10:30.  Case recalled at 10:33 am.  Defendant's appearance waived. Court grants request and changes the jury trial to a court trial.  Court trial scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
